intro: Didymopanax, commonly known as the giant arrowroot or arrowleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Didymopanax moranensis, which is native to South America. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to three meters in diameter, making it one of the largest leafy plants in the world. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, followed by woody fruits containing several seeds. Didymopanax is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
